sub_title: ESG Intern at GRESB | LLM (Summa Cum Laude), MSc (Cum Laude), LLB (Magna Cum Laude), BCom (Distinction in Economics).
summary:
I am a diverse, adaptable, efficient, and driven person who holds 4 first class degrees across universities in South Africa and the Netherlands covering Law, Economics, Philosophy and Politics – all of which were awarded with the highest possible academic distinctions and with both Masters Degrees fully funded through multiple scholarships. Namely, I hold an LLM (Summa Cum Laude), an MSc (Cum Laude), an LLB (Magna Cum Laude), and a BCom (awarded with Distinction in Economics). In addition, I have also completed a series of self-funded international courses in Economics, Psychology, Politics, Philosophy, Marketing, Business, and French in universities across The Czech Republic, The Netherlands, Portugal, and France. 

Resultingly, I offer an enormous pool of interdisciplinary knowledge, high-level analytical and strategic thinking abilities, a unique level of diversity, adaptability, and malleability, as well as a guarantee of extremely high-quality output as evidenced in how I have been a top student in every degree I have studied, regardless of the discipline. In addition, I have worked for a year in Cape Town as a Legal Consultant specializing in strategic commercial litigation and was involved in numerous multi-jurisdictional, large-scale international arbitrations across South Africa and the Seychelles. I have also spent 6 months working for a Climate Change Law Clinic in Amsterdam where I conducted legal and policy research on behalf of NGO’s aimed at finding innovative pathways to stop fossil fuel projects. As such, I thrive in intellectual diversity and revel in the solving of complex, multidisciplinary problems that require the use of various lenses and perspectives. 

During both my MSc and LLM Degrees I have been developing a passion for the Climate Change field which culminated in me writing my MSc Thesis in Climate Policy, and my LLM Thesis on a topic related to Climate Change Litigation – both of which received the highest grade in the class. Thus, I have specialised in Climate Change from both a policy and legal perspective and I am now equipped with knowledge ranging across environmental economics, climate science, sustainable psychology, and climate policy, as well as experience in International, EU and Dutch Climate Change Law covering legislation such as the CSDDD, CSRD, SFDR, EU Taxonomy and EU ETS, to name a few.

In the future I aim to combine my multi-disciplinary academic knowledge, consulting experience, research skills, policy fluency and Climate Change specializiations into making a tangible difference to the world.

education.field_of_study: International Business Law: Climate Change & Corporations

education.degree_name: Master of Science Degree in Philosophy, Politics and Economics

awards.title: LLM Summa Cum Laude
awards.description:
I graduated my LLM as the top student in the class and was awarded Summa Cum Laude.
This is an extremely rare achievement that less than 1% of University Graduates ever obtain.
It requires an average GPA of 9, a Thesis grade of 9, and no course grades under 8.

awards.title: PPE Talent Grant
awards.description: Awarded the PPE Talent Grant for the most talented Non-EU student by the Department of Philosophy.

awards.title: Holland Scholarship
awards.description: I was awarded the Holland Scholarship for the University of Groningen

awards.title: LLB Magna Cum Laude
awards.description: I graduated with my LLB Magna Cum Laude. This required an average of over 75% throughout all the LLB courses in the degree and an additional requirement of receiving a distinction for approximately 70% of all Law Courses completed at UCT.

awards.title: Top Student - Trusts and Estates
awards.description: I was the top student for the Trusts and Estates course in the UCT LLB with a final mark of 92%.

awards.title: Bain & Company Award
awards.description: I received the Bain & Company award for the 2nd Ranked BCom PPE student at the University of Cape Town.

awards.title: BCom PPE with Distinction in Economics
awards.description: I was awarded my BCom PPE Degree with a distinction in Economics. This required an average of over 80% across all of the final year economics courses.

awards.title: UCT Canoeing Half Colors
awards.description: I received Half Colors for Canoeing from the University of Cape Town at the UCT Sports Awards Ceremony in 2015.

awards.title: Deans Merit List
awards.description: I have been on the Deans Merit List for both the Commerce and Law Faculties of the University of Cape Town since 2015. To be on the Deans Merit list for the Commerce Faculty you need to have averaged over 75% for the year and for the Law Faculty you need to have averaged over 70% for the year.

awards.title: Golden Key International Honour Society
awards.description: I have been a member of the Golden Key International Honour Society since 2015. This is a society which recognises students who are ranked in the top 15% of their Degree.

awards.title: Holland Scholarship Programme
awards.description: I was awarded the HSP Scholarship for the VU. This is awarded to excellent students based on academic merit and contributes fees to cover the living costs during the Degree.

awards.title: MSc. Cum Laude
awards.description: I was awarded the MSc Cum Laude which required an average of over 8, a thesis grade of over 8.5 and no resits or grades awarded under 7 throughout the degree.

awards.title: Vrije Universiteit Fellowship Programme [VUFP] Scholarship
awards.description: I was awarded the prestigious VUFP Scholarship to the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam. This Scholarship is a merit based award that is given to excellent students based on previous academic results. The Scholarship covers the full tuition fee for the Degree.

authors.headline: ESG Intern at GRESB | LLM (Summa Cum Laude), MSc (Cum Laude), LLB (Magna Cum Laude), BCom (Distinction in Economics).

profile_positions.description:
I am happy to announce that I have joined the GRESB team (Global Real Estate Sustainability Benchmark) in Amsterdam where I will be working in the field of ESG and sustainable finance. GRESB assesses the Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) performance of real estate and infrastructure portfolios and assets worldwide, and uses this information to provide standardized and validated ESG data to the capital markets. As such, the organization is a key facilitating nexus in the transition to creating more sustainable real assets and it comprises the leading ESG benchmark for real estate and infrastructure investments across the world. 

I am particularly excited about this opportunity because it allows me to enter into an arena that has gradually piqued my interest during my studies over the last few years. Namely, during my LLM in Climate Change Law I realized how 'ESG' has become a recurring thread that is increasingly influencing corporate behavior and which is rapidly weaving its way through policy, law, and finance, with it automatically accompanying every conversation I heard about sustainability. Moreover, I saw how the disclosure of ESG information has become the glue that binds the new wave of EU legislation, such as the CSRD and SFDR, that is seeking to catalyze a recalibration of the economy down more sustainable avenues. Accordingly, working at GRESB will allow me to dive deep into the world of ESG data, sustainability consulting, environmental analysis, sustainable finance and EU regulation on various matters related to climate change

Time to hit the ground running!
profile_positions.title: ESG Intern

profile_positions.description:
I was selected to work for the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam's Climate Change & Sustainability Law Clinic under the supervision of faculty members and on behalf of NGO's.

I was involved in a complex project that entailed legal research and policy analysis in order to assess the possible legal avenues available to shut down a large fossil fuel project. Our team conducted detailed analysis of EU Legislation such as the CSDDD, SFDR, CSRD, UCPD and EU Taxonomy as well as Dutch Legislation such as the NCR and CDR. Moreover, I was responsible for conducting research into Dutch Environmental Policy, Consumer Law, Greenwashing, and Climate Change Litigation. 

The outcome of the project was a 100 page report that will now be used for building future legal claims pertaining to shutting down fossil fuel projects. 

I received the highest grade in the Law Clinic of a 9.5/10 for my efforts and was recognised as the key strategist and guiding nexus for the project.

I also designed a poster and presented our research at the Conference on the Future of Experiential Legal Education hosted by the Amsterdam Law School at the University of Amsterdam.
profile_positions.title: Law & Policy Researcher: Climate Change and Sustainability Law Clinic

profile_positions.description:
I worked for a year as a Legal Consultant for various Advocates of the South African Cape Bar wherein I specialized in strategic commercial litigation and was involved in multiple multi-jurisdictional large-scale arbitrations performing legal research, providing written legal opinions and guiding general strategy.

I was involved in a multi-million-Dollar International Arbitration regarding a construction dispute in the Seychelles where I worked on behalf of a South African senior counsel advocate and the Seychelles based Victoria Law Firm. I was heavily involved in this matter and conducted a broad array of tasks from the beginning to the end of the arbitration, spanning from putting together the trial bundle, drafting pleadings, researching international arbitration law as well as local Seychellois Law, briefing the clients Board of Directors on legal strategy, conducting interviews with independent experts, compiling witness statements, assisting with drafting applications to the Seychelles Supreme Court and a variety of tasks spanning every contour of both the arbitral and judicial process.

I was also involved in a multi-billion-Rand arbitration regarding copyright infringement and unlawful competition between two South African medical aid administration giants. I assisted in drafting witness statements, providing legal research into various areas of delict, contract and competition law and I wrote multiple strategy memos to help guide counsel.

In addition, I was also involved in a variety of different cases spanning across topics including Hedge Funds, Insurance, Trusts, and a slew of complex commercial matters.
profile_positions.title: Legal Consultant

profile_positions.description:
I founded and ran a small business in which I sourced and provided high quality local food products to a customer base of 50+ clients. This was an excellent experience in managing supply chains, dealing with customers, developing a business plan, understanding price and market dynamics and effectively running a small business with a customer base, a diverse product and a monthly income and order list.

I used the income from this business to self-fund a variety of summer school courses in different academic disciplines around the world.
profile_positions.title: Entrepreneur

profile_positions.description: I spent time in the offices of McVean Trading & Investments in Memphis Tennessee. This is a large commodities trading firm in the USA and I was rotated amongst members of the trading, economics and analytics divisions in order to gain an understanding of commodities trading. During my time here I assisted the head of economics and policy in conducting policy research to help provide policy guidance to the traders on the floor.
profile_positions.title: Commodities Trading Internship

profile_positions.description: I spent several weeks working as a Sales Assistant and a Surf Coach at the Xpression on the Beach store on Muizenberg. This was a fun experience which allowed me to learn important lessons in people management and event facilitation along with experience gained in understanding the running of a retail store through detailed sessions with the shop owner.
profile_positions.title: Sales Assistant

profile_positions.location: Cape Town, Western Cape, South Africa
profile_positions.description: I spent a week in the offices of Cliffe Dekker Hofmeyr as part of my High School Job Shadow program wherein I participated in legal research, sat in at consultations, was assigned drafting projects and attended court.
profile_positions.title: Cliffe Dekker Hofmeyr Rotation

volunteer_experiences.description: LAWCO is a program where UCT law students have the opportunity to teach and mentor learners from Khayelitsha and Mitchells Plain on topics of law and broader socio-economic matters. A pre-determined curriculum is taught each week with an emphasis on student participation and engagement.

The President’s Award for Youth Empowerment is the affiliate of the Duke of Edinburgh’s International Award in South Africa. There is a Community Service component to this award which I fulfilled through building a vegetable garden in Khayelitsha.
SMILE was an initiative of Bishops Diocesan College in which volunteers would teach and mentor school children from Khayelitsha through the provision of group english lessons.
